verse: Lamentation over Tyre. This word of the Lord came to me:
Son of man, raise lament over Tyre,
and say to Tyre which is enthroned at the entrance to the sea and serves as the center of trade between the nations and many coastlands: Thus says the Lord God:
Tarshish traded with you because of the vast abundance of your wealth, exchanging silver, iron, tin, and lead for your wares.
Javan, Tubal, and Meshech also traded with you, exchanging slaves and articles of bronze for your merchandise.
Beth-togarmah exchanged horses, steeds, and mules for your wares.
The Rhodians dealt with you; many islands engaged in trade with you and paid you with ivory tusks and ebony.
Edom traded with you because of the large variety of your products; for your wares they exchanged turquoise, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral, and rubies.
Judah and the land of Israel also traded with you, exchanging for your goods wheat, figs, honey, oil, and balm.
Damascus traded with you because of your great wealth, offering to you wine from Helbon and wool from Zahar.
Danites and Javanites traded wrought iron, cassia, and aromatic cane from Uzal for your wares,
while Dedan traded with you for saddle blankets.
Arabia and all the sheikhs of Kedar were your customers, paying you with lambs, rams, and goats.
Merchants from Sheba and Raamah traded with you, offering in exchange the finest spices, every kind of precious stones, and gold.
Haran, Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad traded with you,
offering in return rich garments, embroidered purple cloaks, and materials of many colors bound with cords that were firmly woven.
